pullRequest.body:
Including the result that ideals in a semisimple Lie algebra
are in a unique way the direct sum of simple ideals.
This result makes no assumptions on the ring of coefficients or the Lie algebra;
it holds over arbitrary base rings, and in arbitrary dimensions.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

nodes.body: :v: jcommelin can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

If you have the appetite I think a nice future refactor would be to remove:
```lean
import Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Solvable
```
and move all the dependent material (`HasTrivialRadical` etc.) to its own file.

For bonus points, I think we should also remove this import from `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Nilpotent` and move the two short dependent results into `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Solvable`.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Thanks, this is marvelous!

bors d+

This is really nice!

I only have time for some superficial remarks now. My main thought is whether some of the proofs could be golfed by using more of the results about compactly-generated lattices.

I'll have more to say later.

Thanks, this is marvelous!

bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion non_abelian := IsSemisimple.non_abelian_of_isAtom I hI ```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma isAtom_iff_eq_top [IsSimple R L] (I : LieIdeal R L) : IsAtom I ↔ I = ⊤ :=
```

I think we should probably have some more namespacing
```suggestion

namespace IsSimple

variable [IsSimple R L]

```
and close just above `SemisimpleGenerators`
I think this should be in the module doc string.
Agreed!
Oops... I forgot this :facepalm:

```suggestion
instance (priority := 100) instHasTrivialRadical : HasTrivialRadical R L := by
```

```suggestion
```

This shouldn't be necessary I think
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  · exact h₁ _ <| ofAbelianIsSolvable R I
```

```suggestion
  · rw [← abelian_of_solvable_ideal_eq_bot_iff]
    exact h₁ _ <| abelian_derivedAbelianOfIdeal I
```

```suggestion
  suffices Nontrivial (LieIdeal R L) from ⟨IsSimple.eq_bot_or_eq_top⟩
  rw [LieSubmodule.nontrivial_iff, ← not_subsingleton_iff_nontrivial]
  have _i : ¬ IsLieAbelian L := IsSimple.non_abelian R
  contrapose! _i
  infer_instance
```

```suggestion
lemma isAtom_top : IsAtom (⊤ : LieIdeal R L) :=
  ⟨bot_ne_top.symm, fun _ h ↦ IsSimpleOrder.LT.lt.eq_bot h⟩
```

I think we can get more help from the lattice theory library here. For example:
```lean

lemma isAtomistic_of_sSup_eq_top (h : sSup S = ⊤) : IsAtomistic (LieIdeal R L) := by
  refine ⟨fun J ↦ ?_⟩
  obtain ⟨s, hs, hs'⟩ := atomistic hS J (by aesop)
  exact ⟨s, hs', fun I hI ↦ hS.isAtom I (hs hI)⟩

lemma complementedLattice_of_sSup_eq_top (h : sSup S = ⊤) : ComplementedLattice (LieIdeal R L) := by
  have := isAtomistic_of_sSup_eq_top hS h
  apply complementedLattice_of_isAtomistic

```
and then I presume some of the below lemmas should also become easy / redundant.
Incidentally it's not clear to me why `complementedLattice_of_isAtomistic` isn't an instance.

Nice!

I guess it is not an instance as a remnant of the Lean 3 days, because the other direction is already an instance, and it would create a loop.

We could try to make it an instance in another PR...

> and then I presume some of the below lemmas should also become easy / redundant.

Actually, those lemmas are all working towards showing that the lattice is distributive. I've now indicated that in a comment.
I now completely abstracted these lemmas into lattice theory.

Is this possibly a result about compactly-generated modular lattices, a rather than about the lattice `LieIdeal R L`?

For example I noticed a while ago that independence in such lattices can be characterised just by working with finite sets so I added `CompleteLattice.independent_iff_supIndep_of_injOn` (in #8154)

I admit I haven't read this proof closely so I may be wrong but superficially this looks like a similar result except for being atomistic rather than independent.
I tried my best at abstracting this.

```suggestion
def booleanAlgebraOfComplemented [BoundedOrder α] [ComplementedLattice α] : BooleanAlgebra α where
```

I can't help wondering if it might be easier to establish modularity instead. So the proof would start:
```suggestion
  suffices IsModularLattice α by
    have _i := isAtomistic_of_sSup_eq_top hS h
    apply complementedLattice_of_isAtomistic
```
More generally I'm not sure what order to establish properties would minimize the effort here (e.g., could we establish complementarity first and then get atomisticness from `complementedLattice_iff_isAtomistic` etc.).

However what you have is clearly fine.
Good suggestion! By putting DistribLattice higher about, I could apply this golf. (It implies modular lattice.)

```suggestion
    apply IsSimple.non_abelian (R := R) (L := L)
    rw [IsSimple.isAtom_iff_eq_top] at hI₁
    rwa [hI₁, lie_abelian_iff_equiv_lie_abelian LieIdeal.topEquiv] at hI₂
```

```suggestion
instance (priority := 100) IsSimple.instIsSemisimple [IsSimple R L] :
```

source.title: A semisimple Lie algebra is a direct sum of simple Lie algebras
